description: Reticulum v1.1.3 reference implementation - Retry timer and timeout test vectors
sources: RNS/Resource.py (part timeout, proof timeout, retry progression)

link_keepalive.description: Link keepalive interval and stale timeout derived from RTT
timeout_sequence: 1. Link sends keepalive every 'keepalive' seconds of inactivity
2. If no traffic for 'stale_time', link is marked STALE, final keepalive sent
3. If no traffic for additional 'stale_timeout' after going stale, link is torn down

link_establishment.description: Link establishment timeout based on hop count
link_establishment.note: For 0 hops, max(1, 0) = 1, so minimum is DEFAULT_PER_HOP_TIMEOUT + KEEPALIVE

resource_retry.description: Resource transfer retry timing and timeout progression

formulas.sender_max_wait: rtt * TRAFFIC_TIMEOUT_FACTOR * MAX_RETRIES + SENDER_GRACE_TIME + sum((r+1)*PER_RETRY_DELAY for r in range(MAX_RETRIES))

timeout_sequence: 1. Initial part timeout uses PART_TIMEOUT_FACTOR (4x) with estimated flight time
2. After first RTT measurement, switches to PART_TIMEOUT_FACTOR_AFTER_RTT (2x)
3. Each retry adds PER_RETRY_DELAY * retry_number to the timeout
4. On timeout: window and window_max decrease, then request_next() is called
5. After all parts sent, switches to PROOF_TIMEOUT_FACTOR (3x) for proof wait
6. Sender side uses a single max_wait encompassing all possible retries

resource_advertisement_retry.note: If no part requests received within timeout, advertisement is resent up to MAX_ADV_RETRIES times

notes: tries starts at 1 for the initial send
When rtt*2.5 < 0.025, the minimum 0.025 is used
tx_ring_length is the current number of unacknowledged envelopes
On timeout, tries is incremented and packet is resent
If tries exceeds MAX_TRIES (5), the link is torn down

worked_examples.description: First try, 100ms RTT, 1 packet in flight
Third try, 500ms RTT, 3 packets in flight
Max tries, 2s RTT, 5 packets in flight
First try, 1ms RTT (uses min 0.025), 1 packet in flight
